poem:
Resignation in Dhaka

An autumn wind, unbidden, sweeps
through Dhaka's tired streets,
where students break their silences
against the echo of boots
and the crimson of martyrdom
paints indifferent walls.
Hasina's shadow,
a ghost of spent power,
retreats before young faces
lit with the dawn of demands.
Hope stirs where fear
once lay leaden.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Why has Bangladesh’s prime minister Sheikh Hasina resigned and fled? After 15 years in power, Bangladesh’s prime minister has suddenly resigned and fled the country. Sheikh Hasina’s departure came after weeks of student-led protests were met with deadly force, and has been greeted with jubilation on the streets of the capital, Dhaka. What led to this? Students protested for fairer access to government jobs and were met with violence, including the killing of nearly 300". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
